References.Rmd

Documentation


Publications

Hartin C., E.E. McDuffie, K. Novia, M. Sarofim, B. Parthum, J. Martinich, S. Barr, J. Neumann, J. Willwerth, & A. Fawcett. Advancing the estimates of future climate impacts within the United States, 2023, Earth System Dynamics, https://esd.copernicus.org/articles/14/1015/2023/

Sarofim, M.C., Martinich, J., Neumann, J.E. et al. A temperature binning approach for multi-sector climate impact analysis. Climatic Change 165, 22 2021, https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-021-03048-6

Technical Documentation

FrEDI Technical Documentation and Appendxi:https://www.epa.gov/cira/about-fredi


Example Applications

The Framework for Evaluating Impacts and Damages (FrEDI) has been used to explore climate-related impacts to the United States under a variety of future scenarios. For example applications of FrEDI, including recent peer-reviewed literature studies, as well as links to several recent documents that have included analyses or U.S. impact results informed by FrEDI output, see: https://www.epa.gov/cira/fredi-publications-and-applications
